Name: Sphinx of Queen Hatshepsut
Description: The sphinx of Queen Hatshepsut is carved in a fairly classical pose. The front legs extend forward and the tail curls around the right hind leg. This sphinx is a portrait of Hatshepsut with the elegant feminine features of all her statues: almond-shaped eyes under arched brows, a fine aquiline or hooked nose, and a small smiling mouth. Writing on the chest reads, "Maatkare, Beloved of Amun, may life be given forever."
